author: wsjcom
title: On Decertifying an Underperforming Union
text:
Regarding Peter Schaumber’s “How the NLRB Evades the Law—and Can Bring Itself into Line” (op-ed, April 2): In the 1970s I attended law school at night and worked a day job that included driving a school bus for the local district. Under state law all permanent drivers had to belong to the drivers’ union. Most drivers, however, including myself, found growing dissatisfaction and unhappiness with our union representation.
I learned about a labor-law “IED” known as the National Labor Relations Board’s (NLRB) union decertification...
